H0.text: Being open to new ideas is the characteristic a scientist most likely maintains throughout an investigation.

H1.text: Sharing limited research is a characteristic that a scientist most likely maintains throughout an investigation.

H2.text: Focus on completing research first is the characteristic that a scientist most likely maintains throughout an investigation.

H3.text: Focus on formulating conclusions is a characteristic that a scientist most likely maintains throughout an investigation.

A4.text: Published results of experiments can also serve as a hypothesis predicting their own reproducibility.

A5.text: Failure to develop an interesting hypothesis may lead a scientist to re-define the subject under consideration.

A6.text: The philosophy of science includes the question: What criteria are satisfied by a 'good' theory.
